Description: Tondo sherd of Attic black-figured pottery cup; interior, from outside: alternating red and black tongues between sets of four black bands; added white dots in between the tongues at top of dividing line; in tondo, black-figure decoration consisting of head of Herakles to right (red face and ear of lion-skin; white teeth on lion-skin); at right, top of a woman’s head with part of white forehead and red fillet; possibly Deianeira; exterior: band of double staggered dots between sets of four black bands; to the centre, alternating red and black tongues with white dots between the tongues at top of dividing line; four lines around top of stem.
Curator's comments: The decoration scheme of the cup is unusual; see Beazley and Payne 1929, 267, no. 46.
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (B601.38)
Beazley & Payne 1929 / Attic Black Figured Fragments from Naukratis (p. 267, no. 46)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 379, no. 530)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 233, no. 4)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0690) (Phase 1)
